revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-22 10:16:03.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-hieradata/templates/vip_data.j2'], 'message': "Explicitly set ceph_dashboard_vip when Ceph Dashboard is enabled

When the Ceph Dashboard environment file is added, the haproxy config
is created for both the ceph dashboard and the monitoring stack (made
by grafana, prometheus, alertmanager, node-exporter).
We used to have the 'ceph_dashboard_vip' rely to the ctlplane network
unless the StorageDashboard composable network is explicitly added to
the overcloud deployment.
This patch, instead, explicitly sets the ceph_dashboard_vip using the
'CephDashboardNetwork' parameter defined in tripleo-heat-templates.
By doing this the operator has the flexibility to use the network
defined via tht to reach the Ceph Dashboard, resulting in a more
consistent configuration according to the user expectations.

Change-Id: Icc68dad8074dd02d84f76efac45ed08b42a2bd2f
(cherry picked from commit 5dc5cdb62639fc240fd44b50b5322888fc40efc3)
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set ceph_dashboard_vip when Ceph Dashboard is enabled

When the Ceph Dashboard environment file is added, the haproxy config
is created for both the ceph dashboard and the monitoring stack (made
by grafana, prometheus, alertmanager, node-exporter).
We used to have the 'ceph_dashboard_vip' rely to the ctlplane network
unless the StorageDashboard composable network is explicitly added to
the overcloud deployment.
This patch, instead, explicitly sets the ceph_dashboard_vip using the
'CephDashboardNetwork' parameter defined in tripleo-heat-templates.
By doing this the operator has the flexibility to use the network
defined via tht to reach the Ceph Dashboard, resulting in a more
consistent configuration according to the user expectations.

Change-Id: Icc68dad8074dd02d84f76efac45ed08b42a2bd2f
(cherry picked from commit 5dc5cdb62639fc240fd44b50b5322888fc40efc3)

subject: Add heat-api environment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-07 21:04:13.000000000', 'files': ['environments/services/heat-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Add heat-api environment

Add an environment file that can be used to enable Heat API. While the
service is already enabled by default, there are other environments that
could be used to disable it (such as standalone-tripleo.yaml). Having
this environment makes the service easy to re-enable without having to
use a custom environment file.

Change-Id: Ib60631a1c17786fa6d4aa36da03b819846144806
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add heat-api environment

Add an environment file that can be used to enable Heat API. While the
service is already enabled by default, there are other environments that
could be used to disable it (such as standalone-tripleo.yaml). Having
this environment makes the service easy to re-enable without having to
use a custom environment file.

Change-Id: Ib60631a1c17786fa6d4aa36da03b819846144806
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-20 21:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova/virtlogd.epp'], 'message': 'nova_virtlogd_wrapper: trap "created" containers

When an host shutdown isn't graceful, virtlogd container is orphaned but
in state "Created" (shown as "configured" in podman inspect). This
prevents the recreation of new virtlogd container by the wrapper.

Change-Id: If8356998818a8e0adc3c81f1fa10cb2f18a9a59f
'}]
commit_message:
nova_virtlogd_wrapper: trap "created" containers

When an host shutdown isn't graceful, virtlogd container is orphaned but
in state "Created" (shown as "configured" in podman inspect). This
prevents the recreation of new virtlogd container by the wrapper.

Change-Id: If8356998818a8e0adc3c81f1fa10cb2f18a9a59f

commit_message:
vncproxy: removal of tags and steps change from post_upgrade_tasks

Post upgrade tasks are limited to 4-1 steps, so these
tasks are not executed.

Deleting nova-consoleauth is failing with some of the CIs and this is
mostly a best-effort kind of task, so adding ignore_errors.

Also, replacing some yes/nos with boolean as it's best practice.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1921112
Change-Id: I0bc39170569c42a0be31233fd7ec068613547790
(cherry picked from commit 2001b48ca3430746f407b69d31d9e7e19303f9b8)
(cherry picked from commit 28c866c3e9acde7c34216e059d79ba96a43e6ddb)

commit_message:
Add  tripleo-undercloud job

TripleO uses ironic + networking-baremetal in undercloud while it does
not use ironic in overcloud. This change adds tripleo-undercloud so
that code specific to networking-baremetal is tested.

Change-Id: Ie8e668e4660228d0aa9798f894ffa6a7826850ea

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-22 10:13:36.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_hieradata/templates/vip_data.j2'], 'message': "Explicitly set ceph_dashboard_vip when Ceph Dashboard is enabled

When the Ceph Dashboard environment file is added, the haproxy config
is created for both the ceph dashboard and the monitoring stack (made
by grafana, prometheus, alertmanager, node-exporter).
We used to have the 'ceph_dashboard_vip' rely to the ctlplane network

the overcloud deployment.

'CephDashboardNetwork' parameter defined in tripleo-heat-templates.

commit_message:
Explicitly set ceph_dashboard_vip when Ceph Dashboard is enabled

When the Ceph Dashboard environment file is added, the haproxy config
is created for both the ceph dashboard and the monitoring stack (made
by grafana, prometheus, alertmanager, node-exporter).
We used to have the 'ceph_dashboard_vip' rely to the ctlplane network
unless the StorageDashboard composable network is explicitly added to
the overcloud deployment.
This patch, instead, explicitly sets the ceph_dashboard_vip using the
'CephDashboardNetwork' parameter defined in tripleo-heat-templates.
By doing this the operator has the flexibility to use the network
defined via tht to reach the Ceph Dashboard, resulting in a more
consistent configuration according to the user expectations.

Change-Id: Icc68dad8074dd02d84f76efac45ed08b42a2bd2f
(cherry picked from commit 5dc5cdb62639fc240fd44b50b5322888fc40efc3)

commit_message:
Explicitly set ceph_dashboard_vip when Ceph Dashboard is enabled

When the Ceph Dashboard environment file is added, the haproxy config
is created for both the ceph dashboard and the monitoring stack (made
by grafana, prometheus, alertmanager, node-exporter).
We used to have the 'ceph_dashboard_vip' rely to the ctlplane network
unless the StorageDashboard composable network is explicitly added to
the overcloud deployment.
This patch, instead, explicitly sets the ceph_dashboard_vip using the
'CephDashboardNetwork' parameter defined in tripleo-heat-templates.
By doing this the operator has the flexibility to use the network
defined via tht to reach the Ceph Dashboard, resulting in a more
consistent configuration according to the user expectations.

Change-Id: Icc68dad8074dd02d84f76efac45ed08b42a2bd2f
(cherry picked from commit 5dc5cdb62639fc240fd44b50b5322888fc40efc3)

vncproxy: removal of tags and steps change from post_upgrade_tasks

Post upgrade tasks are limited to 4-1 steps, so these
tasks are not executed.

Deleting nova-consoleauth is failing with some of the CIs and this is
mostly a best-effort kind of task, so adding ignore_errors.

Also, replacing some yes/nos with boolean as it's best practice.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1921112
Change-Id: I0bc39170569c42a0be31233fd7ec068613547790

subject: Add cinder's new attachment support
revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2021-07-23 17:16:49.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/common/cinder_utils.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/common/test_cinder_utils.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_cinder_store.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'glance_store/_drivers/cinder.py', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_multistore_cinder.py'], 'message': "Add cinder's new attachment support

Cinder introduced new attachment API flow in microversion 3.27
(also attachment_complete added in mv 3.44 and support for passing
mode added in mv 3.54) which provides a clean interface to
interact with cinder for attachments and is also required for
multiattach volume support (Related future work).
Nova uses it since a long time and is proven to be stable,
this patch implements the same for glance.
The create volume and delete volume calls are also moved to
cinder_utils file to use the generic exception handler
and keep similar code together for consistency.

Partially Implements: blueprint attachment-api-and-multiattach-support

Change-Id: I2758ed1d5b8e0981faa3eff6f83e1ce5975a01d2
"}]
commit_message:
Add cinder's new attachment support

Cinder introduced new attachment API flow in microversion 3.27
(also attachment_complete added in mv 3.44 and support for passing
mode added in mv 3.54) which provides a clean interface to
interact with cinder for attachments and is also required for
multiattach volume support (Related future work).
Nova uses it since a long time and is proven to be stable,
this patch implements the same for glance.
The create volume and delete volume calls are also moved to
cinder_utils file to use the generic exception handler
and keep similar code together for consistency.

Partially Implements: blueprint attachment-api-and-multiattach-support

Change-Id: I2758ed1d5b8e0981faa3eff6f83e1ce5975a01d2

commit_message:
Add support for RP re-parenting and orphaning

This patch adds the new microversion 1.37 in which changing the
parent_provider_uuid of a resource provider to any other provider
(except in the same subtree to avoid loops) or to null (un-parenting /
orphaning) is supported.

Story: 2008764
Task: 42131
Change-Id: I9d16ab7944d7e6ce725a892827b9508b7ba52d7c

commit_message:
Make explicit the network backend used in the CI jobs

All Neutron CI jobs (except for unit, functional and fullstack jobs),
have explicitly defined the network backend used:
- linuxbridge
- ovs
- ovn

That was discussed and approved during the Neutron CI meetings [1].

[1]https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2021/neutron_ci.2021-06-15-15.00.log.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/797051
Change-Id: I4d18ef3e3adf24cf646e0546e7c38145f5a4aa92

commit_message:
Add amphora_id in store params for failover_amphora

Several tasks require amphora_id parameter to be passed in
get_amphora_for_lb_failover_subflow.
Execution passed results in error:

taskflow.exceptions.NotFound: Mapped argument 'amphora_id' <=
'amphora_id' was not produced by any accessible provider
(1 possible providers were scanned).

Also fix getting ID parameter from amphora dict in
AmphoraIndexListenersReload and add missing retries for create_*
resources in v2 worker.

Change-Id: I5ed6288b2776bd7f1c9b67e9cfd9a8f05b1196be
(cherry picked from commit 1a154839c2dfb5a9c89963b27a96f0adef1038ee)
(cherry picked from commit ee7b262199840bca7f08a111ea535392396bb416)

commit_message:
Retire django-openstack-auth

``django_openstack_auth`` code was merged into the main horizon
repository during the queens release. This repo is already
deprecated and now we can retire it. This patch removes all
references of ``django_openstack_auth`` as mentioned in [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-23 11:51:42.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/functional/base.py', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/volume/v3/common.py', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/volume/v2/common.py', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/volume/v1/common.py'], 'message': 'tests: Handle removal of block-storage v2 API

Cinder recently removed their v2 API [1] which is causing the functional
tests to fail. Improve our 'is_service_enabled' test helper to use the
'versions show' command, which queries the service catalog and can give
us information about the service version as well as answer the more
general "is this service available" question. We also resolve a
long-standing TODO in the process.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: I381069357aa008344e15327adf3a863c0c2e1f04
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
tests: Handle removal of block-storage v2 API

Cinder recently removed their v2 API [1] which is causing the functional
tests to fail. Improve our 'is_service_enabled' test helper to use the
'versions show' command, which queries the service catalog and can give
us information about the service version as well as answer the more
general "is this service available" question. We also resolve a
long-standing TODO in the process.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: I381069357aa008344e15327adf3a863c0c2e1f04

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-23 08:01:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/privileged/agent/linux/ip_lib.py'], 'message': 'Implement namespace creation method

Since [1], Pyroute forks the namespace creation to avoid calling

to return any error feedback sent from the child process.

This patch implements the same fork without any communication. If

that raises a "RuntimeError" exception.

commit_message:
Implement namespace creation method

Since [1], Pyroute forks the namespace creation to avoid calling
destructive routine "libc.unshare(CLONE_NEWNET)" from the main
process. This implementation uses sockets between both processes
to return any error feedback sent from the child process.

This patch implements the same fork without any communication. If
the child process raises an exception other than "OSError(EEXIST)",
the child process returns 1 that is read by the the main process,
that raises a "RuntimeError" exception.

Related-Bug: #1917487

[1]https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/commit/81db2c98a1dda1c575ae087519cb08aa6ffdb39e

Change-Id: I0294586335a71d0757803843f675124bfb450967
(cherry picked from commit eb567478516897fadac1b7d205bef5c86284eace)

commit_message:
Setup dates for Yoga combined election

Yoga cycle is going to have combined election.

As per the TC charter:
- TC election needs to be held in between of R6 to R4 week of Xena release
- PTL election needs to be held on or before R3 week.

Ref: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/charter.html

Release dates:
If we combine both election schedule as per TC charter it comes as:
between R6 to R4 week:
R-6: Aug 23
R-4: Sep 10

Ref: https://releases.openstack.org/xena/schedule.html

Change-Id: Ic58a85b83f8178086a3f1721009ddd4af3594e50

commit_message:
Add 'combined' election support in setup-election-config

setup-election-config script is used to generate the
election dates. As we started doing the combined election
of PTL and TC, we need to add that type of election support
in this tool which will help to generate dates for any
type of election.

Below the is generated data will looks like:

release: yoga
election_type: combined
tag: oct-2021-elections
tc_seats: 4
timeframe:
  name: Wallaby-Xena
  start: 2020-09-25T00:00
  end: 2021-08-24T00:00
  email_deadline: 2021-08-24T00:00
timeline:
- name: TC & PTL Nominations
  start: 2021-08-17T23:45
  end: 2021-08-24T23:45
- name: TC Campaigning
  start: 2021-08-24T23:45
  end: 2021-08-31T23:45
- name: TC & PTL Election
  start: 2021-08-31T23:45
  end: 2021-09-07T23:45

Change-Id: Ib97f7ba794078ed78c9241dce7d40b3fc3519948

commit_message:
Support the new port resource_request format

This patch adds two test class derivatives to run the existing
resource request tests with the new Neutron fixture and therefore
with the new resource_request format.

NOTE: This change only adds as little as possible to make
the existing functional tests passing with the new format. It adds a
bunch of TODOs to remove the assumption that a port only has a single
request group as with the new request format we allow more request
groups per port in neutron.

TODO:
* unit test coverage
* maybe split it up to smaller pieces

blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate
Change-Id: I1a295861d63779cd97a1dce4f9b5cfd8c5fd2e72

TCP and UDP Connect health monitors are now supported by the
provider driver, when the underlying OVN version supports
them.

The health monitor uses the OVN distributed DHCP port as the
source IP for messages, one must exist or the create or update
operation will fail. The list of member ports to monitor is
updated whenever one is created or deleted.

Added support for SBDB notifications for Service Monitor
events generated when the OVN health monitor code detects
issues with connectivity. This will trigger updates to the
Octavia objects as members go on/offline so that the Octavia
API reflects the current running state of the load balancer.

Added a lot of new unit and functional tests to cover all the
new code, and enabled the tempest health monitor feature so
those tests are run as well.

Change-Id: I776a7a6b036ad72ce7eaa1ab39f448b344974be6

commit_message:
Add Health Monitor support

TCP and UDP Connect health monitors are now supported by the
provider driver, when the underlying OVN version supports
them.

The health monitor uses the OVN distributed DHCP port as the
source IP for messages, one must exist or the create or update
operation will fail. The list of member ports to monitor is
updated whenever one is created or deleted.

Added support for SBDB notifications for Service Monitor
events generated when the OVN health monitor code detects
issues with connectivity. This will trigger updates to the
Octavia objects as members go on/offline so that the Octavia
API reflects the current running state of the load balancer.

Added a lot of new unit and functional tests to cover all the
new code, and enabled the tempest health monitor feature so
those tests are run as well.

Change-Id: I776a7a6b036ad72ce7eaa1ab39f448b344974be6

subject: Add basic http authentication support for neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-07-12 16:04:12.000000000', 'files': ['etc/api-paste.ini', 'releasenotes/notes/basic-auth-middleware-5f812399e325425f.yaml', 'requirements.txt', 'neutron/auth.py', 'neutron/conf/common.py', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_auth.py'], 'message': 'Add basic http authentication support for neutron

This adds a middleware to neutron as an alternative to noauth in
standalone environments.

This middleware uses a password file which supports the Apache htpasswd
syntax. This file is read for every request, so no service restart is
required when changes are made.

The only password digest supported is bcrypt, and the ``bcrypt``
python library is used for password checks since it supports ``$2y$``
prefixed bcrypt passwords as generated by the Apache htpasswd utility.

Closes-Bug: #1935847
Change-Id: I3fdcd9fe6a9c4b025f3c6789d57c4377839e72c6
'}]
commit_message:
Add basic http authentication support for neutron

This adds a middleware to neutron as an alternative to noauth in
standalone environments.

This middleware uses a password file which supports the Apache htpasswd
syntax. This file is read for every request, so no service restart is
required when changes are made.

The only password digest supported is bcrypt, and the ``bcrypt``
python library is used for password checks since it supports ``$2y$``
prefixed bcrypt passwords as generated by the Apache htpasswd utility.

Closes-Bug: #1935847
Change-Id: I3fdcd9fe6a9c4b025f3c6789d57c4377839e72c6

subject: Fix self-signed certs distribution
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-20 15:41:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/octavia_certs.yml', 'tasks/octavia_certs_distribute.yml'], 'message': 'Fix self-signed certs distribution

With multinode Octavia setup self and octavia_generate_certs is
True, role fails with distributing certificates.

While correct approach would be to replace that with PKI role, right now
we just patching current approach, by ensuring that facts are set
for octavia_cert_setup_host so we could reliable gain them.

Change-Id: I0dc2488b9e8e33847c9a2646032ac5f926d09133
Closes-Bug: #1936646
'}]
commit_message:
Fix self-signed certs distribution

With multinode Octavia setup self and octavia_generate_certs is
True, role fails with distributing certificates.

While correct approach would be to replace that with PKI role, right now
we just patching current approach, by ensuring that facts are set
for octavia_cert_setup_host so we could reliable gain them.

Change-Id: I0dc2488b9e8e33847c9a2646032ac5f926d09133
Closes-Bug: #1936646

commit_message:
tripleo-common-tempest-plugin - Step 2: End project Gating

The tripleo-common-tempest-plugin repo has never been used actually and
has not been updated for a while. Because there is no plan to use this
repo in the TripleO project, let's retire it to reduce number of repos
we maintain.

commit_message:
Disable docker's ip-forward when iptables disabled

With the new default since Wallaby, starting Docker makes it
enable forwarding and not filter it at all.
This may pose a security risk and should be mitigated.

Closes-Bug: #1931615
Change-Id: I5129136c066489fdfaa4d93741c22e5010b7e89d
(cherry picked from commit 0fa4ee56eb86eb7d4b4e3bb9d9c9993f6906c1bd)

subject: Dynamically generate proxy settings for image syncs
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2021-07-22 18:14:12.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'files/glance_simplestreams_sync.py', 'config.yaml', 'templates/mirrors.yaml', 'unit_tests/test_glance_simplestreams_sync.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Dynamically generate proxy settings for image syncs

sstream-mirror-glance has several endpoints it needs to talk to:

* Image mirrors - typically, public Internet endpoints;
* Keystone - typically, a directly reachable endpoint;
* Glance - typically, a directly reachable endpoint;
* Object store (Swift) - typically, a directly reachable endpoint but
  sometimes it may be deployed externally and added to the region
  catalog in Keystone (in which case it might be accessible via a proxy
  only).

While sstream-mirror-glance does not support specifying proxy settings
for individual directions, since we know all of them based on the
Keystone catalog, a list of endpoints to add to NO_PROXY environment
variable can be generated dynamically.

The complication is that image syncs are periodically done via a cron
job so a juju-run invocation is needed to retrieve relevant proxy
settings from model-config at each invocation of the synchronization
script.

Additionally, the charm is long-lived so there may be some environments
that rely on legacy proxy settings. This change accounts for that and
acts both on juju-prefixed (new) and unprefixed (legacy) proxy settings.

Whether to use proxy settings for connections to the object store API
is controlled by a charm option which the script is made to react to.
Proxy settings are ignored for object store connections by default.

Closes-Bug: #1843486
Change-Id: Ib1fc5d2eebf43d5f98bb8ee405a3799802c8b8dc
'}]
commit_message:
Dynamically generate proxy settings for image syncs

sstream-mirror-glance has several endpoints it needs to talk to:

* Image mirrors - typically, public Internet endpoints;
* Keystone - typically, a directly reachable endpoint;
* Glance - typically, a directly reachable endpoint;
* Object store (Swift) - typically, a directly reachable endpoint but
  sometimes it may be deployed externally and added to the region
  catalog in Keystone (in which case it might be accessible via a proxy
  only).

While sstream-mirror-glance does not support specifying proxy settings
for individual directions, since we know all of them based on the
Keystone catalog, a list of endpoints to add to NO_PROXY environment
variable can be generated dynamically.

The complication is that image syncs are periodically done via a cron
job so a juju-run invocation is needed to retrieve relevant proxy
settings from model-config at each invocation of the synchronization
script.

Additionally, the charm is long-lived so there may be some environments
that rely on legacy proxy settings. This change accounts for that and
acts both on juju-prefixed (new) and unprefixed (legacy) proxy settings.

Whether to use proxy settings for connections to the object store API
is controlled by a charm option which the script is made to react to.
Proxy settings are ignored for object store connections by default.

Closes-Bug: #1843486
Change-Id: Ib1fc5d2eebf43d5f98bb8ee405a3799802c8b8dc

commit_message:
Add support for vlan_limit option

This change introduces support for the vlan_limit option.
This parameter is currently set to 1 by default, but we should set
it to 2 to enable vlan_transparent, which requires nested vlans.

Related-Bug: #1918418
Change-Id: Id9aaab2a1e3ad2d2d43cd5cddf389d20abaf4461

subject: Fix setup-election-config script for TC election dates
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-21 17:40:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_election/cmds/setup_election_config.py'], 'message': 'Fix setup-election-config script for TC election dates

setup-election-config script is still using the old
dates for TC election
"The election is held no later than 6 weeks prior to each
 OpenStack Summit (on or before 'S-6' week)"

and set the offset of 6 weeks of summit or release. As we do not
have summit in every cycle so we need to update it to take
reference from release dates.

Also TC charter is changed 2 year back about new recommended dates
for TC election, which is:

"The election is held no earlier than 6 weeks and no later
than 4 weeks prior to each cycle final release date (between 'R-6' and 'R-4'
week)"

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/699277/6/reference/charter.rst

This commit fix the script with the offset as 4 weeks from release date
so that generated dates will be as per the TC charter.

Change-Id: Id43b67add3ec405bd94c64a9d2d324247914031a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix setup-election-config script for TC election dates

setup-election-config script is still using the old
dates for TC election
"The election is held no later than 6 weeks prior to each
 OpenStack Summit (on or before 'S-6' week)"

and set the offset of 6 weeks of summit or release. As we do not
have summit in every cycle so we need to update it to take
reference from release dates.

Also TC charter is changed 2 year back about new recommended dates
for TC election, which is:

"The election is held no earlier than 6 weeks and no later
than 4 weeks prior to each cycle final release date (between 'R-6' and 'R-4'
week)"

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/699277/6/reference/charter.rst

This commit fix the script with the offset as 4 weeks from release date
so that generated dates will be as per the TC charter.

Change-Id: Id43b67add3ec405bd94c64a9d2d324247914031a

commit_message:
Fix TC election dates timeline in README

Seems like documentation still recommend to select
the TC election dates as
"Needs to conclude by S-3 (3 Weeks prior to OpenStack Summit)"

which is old things and changed in TC charter 2 years back
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/699277/6/reference/charter.rst

This commit fixes those dates and add link to TC charter
to refer while electing it. Ditto for PTL election.

Change-Id: I7d7becbecd10791d071c499d4d4c8714db3041f1

commit_message:
Allow connection to RabbitMQ over SSL

Before this patch, ceilometermiddleware wasn't able to connect to
RabbitMQ with TLS enabled, even less with a custom root CA. This
patch fills the feature gap.

Change-Id: I6cdf45500c53abcfabf5553c6853eac2a90cef2a

commit_message:
Remove iscsi deploy interface

The iscsi deploy interface was removed from Ironic [1]. Switch to the
direct deploy interface instead, which is the default.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/801267

commit_message:
Make tripleo-repos be an ansible collection

- assures ansible modules are not included in sdist/wheel
- makes tripleo-repos a collection with tripleo_repos python being
  vendored inside module_utils
- use a symlink from triple_repo to plugins/module_utils/triple_repos
  for convenience. Note that we cannot do the other way around because
  galaxy build does not follow symlinks, but pbr does not
  have any problem following the symlink.
- extend packaging testing to install collection and test Ansible can
  find the new modules
- updates the excludes inside galaxy.yml to avoid accidental inclusion
  of undesired files when building the collection.
- ensure we have consistent and logic names, making easy to use
  fully qualified ansible module names: tripleo.repos.get_hash and
  triple.repos.yum_config.

Change-Id: I743552a149513868de77cad0855a5c0dc0ae0f71

commit_message:
Fix ironic_ipxe healthcheck on Debian/Ubuntu

The healthcheck checks for a process called httpd, but these distros
call it apache2.  This results in the ironic_ipxe container being marked
as unhealthy.

This change fixes the issue by making the process name distro dependent.

Change-Id: I0b0126e3071146e7f8593ba970ecbed65b36fcfa
Closes-Bug: #1937037
(cherry picked from commit aa28675ca914f5f27be0ba654fe2de13f4617ff1)

commit_message:
Deprecate os-panko role

Since upstream Panko project has retired, we deprecating role for it.

Since we might want to get some patches in for stable branches, we're
deprecating role instead of retiring it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/799802
Change-Id: I35e008bcc9b35373dc6db2672ee1cabb328e7f9b

commit_message:
Replace removed DB methods with current ones

Replace removed Binary with LargeBinary import
Remove reflect=True from Alembic MetaData
Replace removed idle_timeout with connection_recycle_time option

- Binary was removed in SQLAlchemy 1.4.x [1]
- SQLAlchemy was updated to 1.4.15 in u-c [2]
- idle_timeout was removed in oslo.db 10.0.0 [3]
- oslo.db was updated to 10.0.0 in u-c [4]
- idle_timeout was already deprecated and renamed as
  connection_recycle_time [5]

[1] https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/6263#issuecomment-819645247
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/dc86260b283dedc3076d7873f5f031f45e3e3671
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/a857b83c9c28d1fe461d1c06549607c48acf337b
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/f322cc13d8a33e54ccd29d86318dda6533129e20
[5] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/6634218415906192fca891362b8fa0ac50b66284

Change-Id: I13ec9c2b53174cfb2e3cb990ec773588cf68007c

subject: Skip block_storage.v2 test in functional job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-22 15:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Skip block_storage.v2 test in functional job

Cinder deleted the block storage API v2 support[1]. This makes the
openstacksdk-functional-devstack failing with

  openstack.exceptions.NotSupported: The block-storage service for
  devstack:RegionOne exists but does not have any supported versions.

So this patch skip the v2 functional tests from functional job
to unblock the gate and later we can discuss on how to remove the v2
APIs from sdk.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: I2c256885a98558b6f401143db589bfb53bf1fa04
'}]
commit_message:
Skip block_storage.v2 test in functional job

Cinder deleted the block storage API v2 support[1]. This makes the
openstacksdk-functional-devstack failing with

  openstack.exceptions.NotSupported: The block-storage service for
  devstack:RegionOne exists but does not have any supported versions.

So this patch skip the v2 functional tests from functional job
to unblock the gate and later we can discuss on how to remove the v2
APIs from sdk.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: I2c256885a98558b6f401143db589bfb53bf1fa04

commit_message:
yaml.load: Set Loader to avoid deprecation warning

Since PyYAML 5.1, yaml.load without specifying the Loader option is
deprecated and shows the following warning.

YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated,
as the default Loader is unsafe.
Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.

This change adds the Loader option to get rid of that warning message.

Change-Id: Ib785e9a11b5de5b0317959efc1c5a61d63175d59

commit_message:
Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

Change-Id: If7b3640191d84e5cf30cbbcb1cc94aa0f068d11c
(cherry picked from commit 2225f9666b157de773fc1dadf195034e24e2577b)
(cherry picked from commit d5b8ced547f5bf163b7ef76ef82a687af61434f9)
(cherry picked from commit 0b5b09c123a40a3f68cd8fb6be2f8da9fe91f31a)

commit_message:
Make standalone-ipa jobs voting again - minus train

The standalone-ipa job was made non-voting due to
uneven results on various cloud providers.

Since https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757943/ merged,
this review makes the standalone-ipa job voting again
on master/victoria/ussuri.
This test has never passed on train.

Change-Id: I367d9293754a22c8bfe3af30d023f1dd35e87cf3

commit_message:
Switch from pacemaker standby to pacemaker stop

Currently, the "snapshots" backup is being taken after taking out one
node from the cluster using pcs node standby. The consequence of it is
that the standby property is also being backuped, so when the node is
restored, it appears as standby and it needs to be unstandby manually.

Switching to pcs cluster stop/pcs cluster start does not make the playbook take any
longer, nor it creates an impact on the time the vips take to be
migrated to a different node while provides the advantage that when the
node is restarted (during restore), pacemaker starts correctly without
any other manual step.

Not a clean cherry pick due to different naming of the role directory.

Change-Id: Ided482f7eaed8d5e1fac60679ef3ba07bda41c0c
(cherry picked from commit 0fb4873ca01c76350b162fcf574dafe970f760df)
(cherry picked from commit 76d61eaccbd4474b04f4b338f8edd1b2a6937f6f)

commit_message:
Switch from pacemaker standby to pacemaker stop

Currently, the "snapshots" backup is being taken after taking out one
node from the cluster using pcs node standby. The consequence of it is
that the standby property is also being backuped, so when the node is
restored, it appears as standby and it needs to be unstandby manually.

Switching to pcs cluster stop/pcs cluster start does not make the playbook take any
longer, nor it creates an impact on the time the vips take to be
migrated to a different node while provides the advantage that when the
node is restarted (during restore), pacemaker starts correctly without
any other manual step.

Change-Id: Ided482f7eaed8d5e1fac60679ef3ba07bda41c0c
(cherry picked from commit 0fb4873ca01c76350b162fcf574dafe970f760df)
(cherry picked from commit 76d61eaccbd4474b04f4b338f8edd1b2a6937f6f)

commit_message:
Remove become: true from the role

The role is always executed with --become, as it is specified in the
documentation. The CLI also invokes the role with --become parameter. In
this case, we were currently implementing a non consistent become
policy. As almost all the tasks in the role require root access, it is
more consistent to remove all the become: true entries and launch the
role with --become parameter.

Not a clean cherry pick due to different naming of the role directory.

Depends-on: Id2aff61f219b0c4992f6f0045f1aba2c7d129758
Change-Id: I263e05c905e3ea6f3f25f4e5a1b8dfb25f6a3f97
(cherry picked from commit fad1ea42cea2087e85948ab666978a2c32d60a00)
(cherry picked from commit 6cb6a99c4b56cf4b401d4f5507025095fa937487)

subject: Introducing the ComputeVdpa role
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 20733, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'ratailor@redhat.com', 'username': 'rajesht'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-07-19 15:33:51.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-computevdpa-role-1f7c5df94d9900b6.yaml', 'roles/ComputeVdpa.yaml', 'tools/yaml-validate.py'], 'message': "Introducing the ComputeVdpa role

Now that nova supports libvirt's vDPA implementation [1][2], we need
deployment code to enable such a feature.

The ComputeVdpa role is basically a copy of ComputeSriov with the
addition of the ExtraKernelModules. Beside these modules, operators
should define to their ``NovaPCIPassthrough`` as they normally do
for standard SR-IOV as a role parameter.

When having the right modules loaded, at least in RHEL8.5, the kernel
will automatically create /dev/vhost-vdpa-X devices for each one of the
VFs.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/src/branch/master/specs/wallaby/implemented/libvirt-vdpa-support.rst
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1873409

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-net-config/+/801255/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1917762
Change-Id: Ifda3ac08c596f65bc75d869097a0f72e816ba783

commit_message:
Introducing the ComputeVdpa role

Now that nova supports libvirt's vDPA implementation [1][2], we need
deployment code to enable such a feature.

The ComputeVdpa role is basically a copy of ComputeSriov with the
addition of the ExtraKernelModules. Beside these modules, operators
should define to their ``NovaPCIPassthrough`` as they normally do
for standard SR-IOV as a role parameter.

When having the right modules loaded, at least in RHEL8.5, the kernel
will automatically create /dev/vhost-vdpa-X devices for each one of the
VFs.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/src/branch/master/specs/wallaby/implemented/libvirt-vdpa-support.rst
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1873409

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-net-config/+/801255/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1917762
Change-Id: Ifda3ac08c596f65bc75d869097a0f72e816ba783
(cherry picked from commit 7010a27415cc1da9f80fbdedcf9aee538f4ce4a6)

commit_message:
Enable image copy for multiple RBD Glance stores

Previously when using multiple RBD glance stores the operator was
responsible for copying the image to all stores.
Nova-compute now has the ability to automatically copy an image to the
local glance store when required.
This change enables the feature and adds the following role specific
parameters to control the behaviour:
  NovaGlanceRbdCopyPollInterval
  NovaGlanceRbdCopyTimeout

Related Nova change: Ia839ad418b0f2887cb8e8f5ee3e660a0751db9ce

Depends-On: I227f40111591cfe1026ce992b3de3e28d092f329
Change-Id: If7532022f399115357f1fdfa9a510d615ed55609
(cherry picked from commit 4aeb3f35430f76b864cd3d11a16d195405b8899d)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-07-22 10:29:15.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/backup-and-restore/backup/tasks/db_backup.yml'], 'message': 'Backup and Restore playbook is not 100% idempotent when running in snapshot mode

This fix a small issue that can happen when the user directly cancels
the execution of the playbook when the rear backup is happening. After
that, the node remains disconnected from pacemaker and it is necessary
to add it back to the cluster so the mysql-galera container is running
when we do the mysql dump.

As the pcs cluster start is an idempotent command in itself, we do not

(cherry picked from commit a1ae19060bc60cab8638b5e410cf54dc7aa349b9)
'}]
commit_message:
Backup and Restore playbook is not 100% idempotent when running in snapshot mode

This fix a small issue that can happen when the user directly cancels
the execution of the playbook when the rear backup is happening. After
that, the node remains disconnected from pacemaker and it is necessary
to add it back to the cluster so the mysql-galera container is running
when we do the mysql dump.

As the pcs cluster start is an idempotent command in itself, we do not
need to perform a verification check before running it nor it will
generate errors (return 1) when ran if it was already running.

Not a clean cherry pick due to different naming of the role directory.

Closes-Bug: #1934897

Change-Id: I9a425665f4714751d8b1a0bd381533e4c383df9d
(cherry picked from commit aa93f9d7a05d33bdf0aa6177da10f51a1e784bc2)
(cherry picked from commit a22d8d9817e07b76ccd83211659fea55796b735b)
(cherry picked from commit a1ae19060bc60cab8638b5e410cf54dc7aa349b9)

subject: NFS: Update connection info on online snap create
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-07 14:27:24.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/nfs-online-snapshot-c05e6c8113bbded6.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_remotefs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/remotefs.py'], 'message': "NFS: Update connection info on online snap create

The NFS snapshot creation for an attached volume requires interaction
between Nova and Cinder, and a new qcow2 file is used after the
attachment completes.

This means that the connection properties stored in the Attachment is no
longer valid, as it is pointing to the old qcow2 file, so if Nova tries
to use that attachment it will start writing on the old qcow2 file.

A flow showing this issue is:

- Attach NFS volume
- Create snapshot
- Hard reboot

After that the VM will start using the base image, breaking the qcow2
chain.

If we delete the snapshot in the meantime, then the VM will fail to
reboot.

This patch fixes this inconsistency by updating the connection info
field inside the remotefs driver.

We usually prefer that drivers don't to touch the DB, directly or
indirectly (using OVOs), but in this case we are using OVOs methods
instead of the usual model update on the volume manager because there
are cases in the driver where a snapshot is created (cloning via
snapshot) and we have to update the attachment without the manager, as
it is unaware that a temporary snapshot is being created.

Besides that main reason there are other less critical reasons to do the
attachment update in the driver:

- Smaller code change
- Easier to backport
- Limit change impact on other areas (better for backport)
- The snapshot_create model update code in the manager does not support
  updating attachments.
- There are cases in the cinder volume manager where the model update
  values returned by snapshot_create are not being applied.

Snapshot deletion belonging to in-use volumes are not affected by this
issue because we only do block commit when the snapshot file we are
deleting is not the active file.  In _delete_snapshot_online:

        if utils.paths_normcase_equal(info['active_file'],
                                      info['snapshot_file']):

Closes-Bug: #1860913
Change-Id: I62fcef3169dcb9f4363a5344af4b2711edfef632
"}]
commit_message:
NFS: Update connection info on online snap create

The NFS snapshot creation for an attached volume requires interaction
between Nova and Cinder, and a new qcow2 file is used after the
attachment completes.

This means that the connection properties stored in the Attachment is no
longer valid, as it is pointing to the old qcow2 file, so if Nova tries
to use that attachment it will start writing on the old qcow2 file.

A flow showing this issue is:

- Attach NFS volume
- Create snapshot
- Hard reboot

After that the VM will start using the base image, breaking the qcow2
chain.

If we delete the snapshot in the meantime, then the VM will fail to
reboot.

This patch fixes this inconsistency by updating the connection info
field inside the remotefs driver.

We usually prefer that drivers don't to touch the DB, directly or
indirectly (using OVOs), but in this case we are using OVOs methods
instead of the usual model update on the volume manager because there
are cases in the driver where a snapshot is created (cloning via
snapshot) and we have to update the attachment without the manager, as
it is unaware that a temporary snapshot is being created.

Besides that main reason there are other less critical reasons to do the
attachment update in the driver:

- Smaller code change
- Easier to backport
- Limit change impact on other areas (better for backport)
- The snapshot_create model update code in the manager does not support
  updating attachments.
- There are cases in the cinder volume manager where the model update
  values returned by snapshot_create are not being applied.

Snapshot deletion belonging to in-use volumes are not affected by this
issue because we only do block commit when the snapshot file we are
deleting is not the active file.  In _delete_snapshot_online:

        if utils.paths_normcase_equal(info['active_file'],
                                      info['snapshot_file']):

Closes-Bug: #1860913
Change-Id: I62fcef3169dcb9f4363a5344af4b2711edfef632

commit_message:
Add CIVS opt-in vote step in election process

CIVS changed its policy on email communication in
April 2021. For all the private poll, eveyr user needs to
op-in the email communication from CIVS to get the poll
link etc. Opting in is done using the “Activate user” page:
 https://civs1.civs.us/cgi-bin/opt_in.pl.

let's document that steps in our election process.

Change-Id: I5db382410de6b523127c813c889d5522a1368b79

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2021-03-26 10:44:56.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Remove unnecesary db call in volume_detached

The `_volume_get` method does a joined load that gets the volume
attachments, so there's no reason to call method
`volume_attachment_get_all_by_volume_id` in `volume_detached` to get
them.

This patch removes the unnecessary DB call which allows us to do a
simpler check to determine the value of `remain_attachment`.

Change-Id: Ia951945b53a1085ff62033d0b665a9b6153a021b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecesary db call in volume_detached

The `_volume_get` method does a joined load that gets the volume
attachments, so there's no reason to call method
`volume_attachment_get_all_by_volume_id` in `volume_detached` to get
them.

This patch removes the unnecessary DB call which allows us to do a
simpler check to determine the value of `remain_attachment`.

Change-Id: Ia951945b53a1085ff62033d0b665a9b6153a021b

subject: Ensure update config function can handle new headers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-06-28 19:06:10.000000000', 'files': ['src/lib/charm/openstack/mysql_router.py', 'unit_tests/test_lib_charm_openstack_mysql_router.py'], 'message': 'Ensure update config function can handle new headers

The linked bug occurred due to a new header for the config file being in
the upgraded charm, but not in the previous version of the charm.  As
the config file is read, updated, and then written, new headings in the
INI file would crash the charm code with a KeyError.

This patch just sets the header and parameter if it is missing.

Closes-Bug: #1927981
Change-Id: I18a6a4143ee0a1144eade5caa50611b802cba28a
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure update config function can handle new headers

The linked bug occurred due to a new header for the config file being in
the upgraded charm, but not in the previous version of the charm.  As
the config file is read, updated, and then written, new headings in the
INI file would crash the charm code with a KeyError.

This patch just sets the header and parameter if it is missing.

Closes-Bug: #1927981
Change-Id: I18a6a4143ee0a1144eade5caa50611b802cba28a

commit_message:
Make ipxe bootfile name configurable

This is a follow up of 3864e15998b5b1eec7d2b1b4911add9bb899fdb8 and
allows using a different name for ipxe bootfile. This is useful if
a user needs to switch back to ipxe*.efi from ipxe-snponly*.efi for
some reasons.

Conflicts:
	manifests/pxe.pp

Change-Id: I565e3ae6388812c358e86fac49b17e0cce97b9df
(cherry-picked from commit 918b3116634d1be812aa5e0359eff9119ffe87a6)

subject: Spawn radvd on standby DVR-HA routers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-15 17:07:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py'], 'message': "Spawn radvd on standby DVR-HA routers

Currently, radvd is spawned only on the Primary DVR-HA Router
and local DVR routers on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr mode.
Radvd is not spawned on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr_snat
mode. RAs from the Primary Router don't reach VMs located on these
dvr_snat Computes and they have no radvd of their own, which means
these VMs cannot set their IPv6.

This is solved by spawning radvd on all DVR-HA Routers - both
Primary and Backup.

Closes-Bug: #1934666
Change-Id: Ib6cd04dd4b6265a4d348d992ea2e18f61da54ae6
"}]
commit_message:
Spawn radvd on standby DVR-HA routers

Currently, radvd is spawned only on the Primary DVR-HA Router
and local DVR routers on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr mode.
Radvd is not spawned on Computes with L3 Agent set to dvr_snat
mode. RAs from the Primary Router don't reach VMs located on these
dvr_snat Computes and they have no radvd of their own, which means
these VMs cannot set their IPv6.

This is solved by spawning radvd on all DVR-HA Routers - both
Primary and Backup.

Closes-Bug: #1934666
Change-Id: Ib6cd04dd4b6265a4d348d992ea2e18f61da54ae6

subject: Correct reno for archiving task_log database records
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-16 21:58:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/archive-task-logs-fa9dd7c5859b5e30.yaml'], 'message': 'Correct reno for archiving task_log database records

The release note incorrectly stated that the Telemetry service calls
the /os-instance_usage_audit_log REST API to retrieve instance usage
data. Telemetry rather consumes the notifications that are only generated
when [DEFAULT]instance_usage_audit=True.

Related-Bug: #1877189

Change-Id: Iea358090c42877bedfdcc4a04019f6dc406176c2
'}]
commit_message:
Correct reno for archiving task_log database records

The release note incorrectly stated that the Telemetry service calls
the /os-instance_usage_audit_log REST API to retrieve instance usage
data. Telemetry rather consumes the notifications that are only generated
when [DEFAULT]instance_usage_audit=True.

Related-Bug: #1877189

Change-Id: Iea358090c42877bedfdcc4a04019f6dc406176c2

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-07-22 09:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_metadef_resources.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_db_metadef.py'], 'message': 'DB layer suppress Forbidden to NotFound error

DB layer for metadef covers up a Forbidden error with NotFound in case
trying to perform any operation on namespace which user does not own.

This patch has removed this cover up so that end user will get
appropriate error message.

Change-Id: I9f05961c0b56efbede321271259848cfc96a98ee
'}]
commit_message:
DB layer suppress Forbidden to NotFound error

DB layer for metadef covers up a Forbidden error with NotFound in case
trying to perform any operation on namespace which user does not own.

This patch has removed this cover up so that end user will get
appropriate error message.

Change-Id: I9f05961c0b56efbede321271259848cfc96a98ee

commit_message:
[fix] cleanup metadata before index creation

This ps adds the code to clean up metatdata in same script as index creation.
Also deletes the explicit job for flushing as that was periodically
causing race condition during pod creation.

Change-Id: I50d8d05e07a52231be607fb6479cb94c94566542

subject: Remove block storage v2 func tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-22 14:36:31.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/functional/block_storage/v2/test_snapshot.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_storage/v2/test_type.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_storage/v2/test_volume.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_storage/v2/base.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_storage/v2/test_stats.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_storage/v2/__init__.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/block_storage/v2/test_backup.py'], 'message': 'Remove block storage v2 func tests

Cinder deleted the block storage API v2 support[1]. This makes the
openstacksdk-functional-devstack failing with

  openstack.exceptions.NotSupported: The block-storage service for
  devstack:RegionOne exists but does not have any supported versions.

So this patch removes the v2 functional tests from master as they cannot
be run any more. Later patches might needs to remove the whole v2
support.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: I277c2a9269dff7602b3f36e3bb7b5fe2a5be1819
'}]
commit_message:
Remove block storage v2 func tests

Cinder deleted the block storage API v2 support[1]. This makes the
openstacksdk-functional-devstack failing with

  openstack.exceptions.NotSupported: The block-storage service for
  devstack:RegionOne exists but does not have any supported versions.

So this patch removes the v2 functional tests from master as they cannot
be run any more. Later patches might needs to remove the whole v2
support.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299

Change-Id: I277c2a9269dff7602b3f36e3bb7b5fe2a5be1819

commit_message:
Add ovn-monitor-all option to ovn-controller

With monitor-all option, all ovn-controllers
do not enable conditional monitoring there
by reducing the load on the Southbound ovsdb-server.

Partial-Bug: #1936781
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>

This change removes the async instruction and polling from the container
build command. This is being done to ensure that the command is blocking
and to ensure we're respecting return codes when / if the build process
fails. At present the async instructions mask shell failures and this is
creating hard to debug issues further in the deployment process.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove async from the container build command

This change removes the async instruction and polling from the container
build command. This is being done to ensure that the command is blocking
and to ensure we're respecting return codes when / if the build process
fails. At present the async instructions mask shell failures and this is
creating hard to debug issues further in the deployment process.

Closes-Bug: 1894067
Change-Id: I84592c98214490ae236ef77f0d733fc94902a9a0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2021-07-22 02:45:11.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-ansible-cache-6597fbe280147612.yaml', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': "Enable Ansible fact cache

Without a fact cache for Ansible, using --start-at-task
doesn't work since it doesn't have the required Ansible
facts for the deployment to proceed. This change enables
the Ansible Fact Cache plugin and caches facts in the
workdir for the Playbook execution.

Closes-Bug: #1937140
Change-Id: Id4ef377c93e6439407ea4aba7f124dc73d0b8410
"}]
commit_message:
Enable Ansible fact cache

Without a fact cache for Ansible, using --start-at-task
doesn't work since it doesn't have the required Ansible
facts for the deployment to proceed. This change enables
the Ansible Fact Cache plugin and caches facts in the
workdir for the Playbook execution.

Closes-Bug: #1937140
Change-Id: Id4ef377c93e6439407ea4aba7f124dc73d0b8410

commit_message:
Update db backup/restore retry for sending to remote

There is an additional error status 'Service Unavailable' which can
indicate the service is temporary unavailable. Adding that error
status to the retry list in case the issue is resolved during the
backup timeframe.

Change-Id: I9e2fc1a9b33dea3858de06b10d512da98a635015

commit_message:
Revert "Combine new modules into a single package"

This reverts commit 0ecc6e0bbbb0ca788e6924fcfb4925d6d30a108a.

Reason for revert: Broken requirements for rpm packaging. Unit tests
require ansible but is not capture in the rpm specs. Also, that is a 
problem just like adding cliff to the requirements as ansible
is not available by default.

Change-Id: I42ae05e4a674dfae544cfd8113ced5c41207740b

subject: Don't generate 10-neutron_wsgi.conf with internal tls
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 13425, 'name': 'Simon Dodsley', 'email': 'simon@purestorage.com', 'username': 'sdodsley'}, {'_account_id': 14250, 'name': 'Grzegorz Grasza', 'email': 'xek@redhat.com', 'username': 'xek'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-21 03:26:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/neutron/server.pp'], 'message': "Don't generate 10-neutron_wsgi.conf with internal tls

When internal TLS is enabled we use a proxy in front of
neutron server. Config generated in change
I302558e718ce35c4d632137c5efa08f502939b40 conflicts with
the one generated for tls_proxy. Till we convert neutron_api
to be deployed with httpd, let's generate the wsgi config
only when enable_internal_tls is false.

Closes-Bug: #1936776
Change-Id: I2901ea548332a043a8ffeb268f3a0ccbca265377
"}]
commit_message:
Don't generate 10-neutron_wsgi.conf with internal tls

When internal TLS is enabled we use a proxy in front of
neutron server. Config generated in change
I302558e718ce35c4d632137c5efa08f502939b40 conflicts with
the one generated for tls_proxy. Till we convert neutron_api
to be deployed with httpd, let's generate the wsgi config
only when enable_internal_tls is false.

Closes-Bug: #1936776
Change-Id: I2901ea548332a043a8ffeb268f3a0ccbca265377

commit_message:
Pin tenacity and psycopg2 for py35/xenial

The libraries:

 * tenacity >= 8.0.0
 * psycopg2 >= 2.9.0
 * requests >= 2.26.0

dropped py35 support, thus breaking on Xenial.  This pins those
libraries.

Change-Id: Ie565747b28d0e21c83725837516b04db641de4a5
Closes-Bug: #1934107

subject: Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-21 21:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/functions/pacemaker_bundle_replicas.rb'], 'message': 'Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function

On CentOS9, the cibadmin query is returning '\n' if the bundle is not
defined which results in:

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, invalid
value for Integer(): "\n" (line: 1, column: 1) on node
standalone-0.localdomain

This change strips whitespace from the check to ensure it has a value
before we attempt to convert to an integer.

Change-Id: I369644d491357a8cdeae3eff51f4f595b1033b66
(cherry picked from commit 256d677dc74a96a2004213189730e6e0b9bbd195)
'}]
commit_message:
Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function

On CentOS9, the cibadmin query is returning '\n' if the bundle is not
defined which results in:

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, invalid
value for Integer(): "\n" (line: 1, column: 1) on node
standalone-0.localdomain

This change strips whitespace from the check to ensure it has a value
before we attempt to convert to an integer.

Change-Id: I369644d491357a8cdeae3eff51f4f595b1033b66
(cherry picked from commit 256d677dc74a96a2004213189730e6e0b9bbd195)

commit_message:
[WIP][ffwd] Symlink /boot/grub2/grubenv /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv

Last option to make efi work on most systems is to
by default symlink the two grubenv files. This means
that some older RHEL8 grub will fail to boot.

Change-Id: I5f3556842f33d5a7ce1f384b7cab698ea7d0aaee

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d
(cherry picked from commit a57255b9fc9e30327d73b5fd502c2037f9c212dc)

commit_message:
Improvements to federation packaging

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages
being present at any time to avoid conflicts.

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d
(cherry picked from commit a57255b9fc9e30327d73b5fd502c2037f9c212dc)

subject: Force sync before checking clock status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-05-21 21:02:58.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-base/tests/test_overcloud_host_configure.py'], 'message': 'Force sync before checking clock status

We are seeing occasional failures of the test_ntp_clock_synchronized
test in the kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-ubuntu-focal job:

______________________ test_ntp_clock_synchronized[local] ______________________
host = <testinfra.host.Host local>
    def test_ntp_clock_synchronized(host):
        # Tests that the clock is synchronized
        status_output = host.check_output("timedatectl status")
>       assert "synchronized: yes" in status_output
E       AssertionError: assert 'synchronized: yes' in '               Local time: Fri 2021-05-21 06:41:41 HST  \n           Universal time: Fri 2021-05-21 16:41:41 UTC  \n ...  \n              NTP service: active                       \n          RTC in local TZ: no                           '
src/opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/playbooks/kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-base/tests/test_overcloud_host_configure.py:171: AssertionError

Forcing a clock sync before checking clock status should prevent this
issue.

Change-Id: Iaba35f237c75392586a4d86baef9bc7836c3fe1b
'}]
commit_message:
Force sync before checking clock status

We are seeing occasional failures of the test_ntp_clock_synchronized
test in the kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-ubuntu-focal job:

______________________ test_ntp_clock_synchronized[local] ______________________
host = <testinfra.host.Host local>
    def test_ntp_clock_synchronized(host):
        # Tests that the clock is synchronized
        status_output = host.check_output("timedatectl status")
>       assert "synchronized: yes" in status_output
E       AssertionError: assert 'synchronized: yes' in '               Local time: Fri 2021-05-21 06:41:41 HST  \n           Universal time: Fri 2021-05-21 16:41:41 UTC  \n ...  \n              NTP service: active                       \n          RTC in local TZ: no                           '
src/opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/playbooks/kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-base/tests/test_overcloud_host_configure.py:171: AssertionError

Forcing a clock sync before checking clock status should prevent this
issue.

Change-Id: Iaba35f237c75392586a4d86baef9bc7836c3fe1b

subject: ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'mjuszkiewicz@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrw'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2021-07-22 08:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/ironic/defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/enable-ipxe-cf461344bdb99881.yaml', 'doc/source/reference/bare-metal/ironic-guide.rst'], 'message': 'ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one currently deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For
this reason, this patch always enables the HTTP server running on the
conductor.

iPXE is still enabled separately, since it cannot currently be used at
the same time as PXE.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
'}]
commit_message:
ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one currently deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For
this reason, this patch always enables the HTTP server running on the
conductor.

iPXE is still enabled separately, since it cannot currently be used at
the same time as PXE.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6

subject: Fix ironic_ipxe healthcheck on Debian/Ubuntu
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'mjuszkiewicz@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrw'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-21 09:03:55.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-deb-ironic-ipxe-heathcheck-2ae5fd0537c056ce.yaml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix ironic_ipxe healthcheck on Debian/Ubuntu

The healthcheck checks for a process called httpd, but these distros
call it apache2.  This results in the ironic_ipxe container being marked
as unhealthy.

This change fixes the issue by making the process name distro dependent.

Change-Id: I0b0126e3071146e7f8593ba970ecbed65b36fcfa
Closes-Bug: #1937037
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic_ipxe healthcheck on Debian/Ubuntu

The healthcheck checks for a process called httpd, but these distros
call it apache2.  This results in the ironic_ipxe container being marked
as unhealthy.

This change fixes the issue by making the process name distro dependent.

Change-Id: I0b0126e3071146e7f8593ba970ecbed65b36fcfa
Closes-Bug: #1937037

commit_message:
Xena-2 Release for python-cinderclient

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for python-cinderclient,
released as version 8.0.0.  It removes support for the Block
Storage API version 2, which was deprecated in Pike by change
I913c44799cdd.

Removing v2 support from the cinderclient was discussed on the
openstack-discuss mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018876.html

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9086dc5a86969dad6110ba837aba49df7444e058

subject: Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-05 15:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/ceph-guide.rst'], 'message': 'Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.

To use feature of external journal drive , install guide inform
to create a partition with parted as below.

parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J 0 5GB
parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D 5GB 100%

Our prediction is that two partitions are created,
but in reality only one partition is created as below.

Number Start End Size File system Name Flags
 1 5000MB 107GB 102GB KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D

Because KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J was override
by KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D.

To create two partitions, we need to remove mklabel gpt
in second command to create patition.

Closes-Bug: #1702500

Change-Id: Ic4e9da5d8c24c666319e728e38e55f23305c2134
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.

To use feature of external journal drive , install guide inform
to create a partition with parted as below.

parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J 0 5GB
parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D 5GB 100%

Our prediction is that two partitions are created,
but in reality only one partition is created as below.

Number Start End Size File system Name Flags
 1 5000MB 107GB 102GB KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D

Because KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J was override
by KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D.

To create two partitions, we need to remove mklabel gpt
in second command to create patition.

Closes-Bug: #1702500

Change-Id: Ic4e9da5d8c24c666319e728e38e55f23305c2134
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

commit_message:
Support ceph device classes feature

Device classes[1] is a new property of OSD. This feature allows the
data in the ceph pool to be placed in the specified OSDs. Only need
to specify the corresponding device class in the crush rule.

This commit supports the device classes feature and updates the steps
to create a pool.

[1]https://ceph.com/community/new-luminous-crush-device-classes/

Change-Id: Icd09101d10088955337b32026361983c6b7d5c7c

subject: Support for specifying ceph daemons to be deployed
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-22 05:35:54.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/upgrade.yml', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/reconfigure.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/deploy.yml'], 'message': 'Support for specifying ceph daemons to be deployed

Currently, deploying ceph using kolla-ansible will include all
enabled daemons, such as mon, mgr, osd, rgw and mds, etc. But the
disadvantage is that modifying one daemon may affect all other
daemons.
For example, when osd is broken, the user only wants to redeploy osd
and does not want to redeploy other daemons.

This function can be used with --limit (limit the node that the task
executes), so that you can modify a daemon on a node.

Change-Id: Ia904d98b2677a478bf67df45b5d36193fc52766a
Closes-bug: #1822250
'}]
commit_message:
Support for specifying ceph daemons to be deployed

Currently, deploying ceph using kolla-ansible will include all
enabled daemons, such as mon, mgr, osd, rgw and mds, etc. But the
disadvantage is that modifying one daemon may affect all other
daemons.
For example, when osd is broken, the user only wants to redeploy osd
and does not want to redeploy other daemons.

This function can be used with --limit (limit the node that the task
executes), so that you can modify a daemon on a node.

Change-Id: Ia904d98b2677a478bf67df45b5d36193fc52766a
Closes-bug: #1822250

commit_message:
POC: Enable check-requirements

This should enable check-requirements job which is a pre-requisite for
having a project listed under openstack requirements. This should allow
us to control the version of molecule being used during testing without
having to update our local requirements so often.

Change-Id: Iba95dceb1bc585702f558e706b65c20c62074b95
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/797620

commit_message:
Add mon detection to ceph deployment

When using '--limit' to deploy a node of ceph, such as repairing mon,
repairing osd and other tasks, kolla-ansbile will report an error.
This is because the current deployment must include the mon node to
set the 'delegate_host' parameter.

This commit fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ic484467cfde2b00694d6685beb8c29b9b630cdbb
Closes-bug: #1822219

revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2019-05-09 02:33:44.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/distribute_keyrings.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_mons.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/config_mdss.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_osds.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/generate_cluster.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/handlers/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_ceph_dashboard.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/check_mons.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/reconfigure.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/stop.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/bootstrap_mons.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_rgws.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/enable_ceph_mgr_module.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_nfss.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/config_mgrs.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/create_cephfs.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/config_nfss.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/config_osds.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/upgrade.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/fetch_keyrings.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/start_mgrs.yml', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/pull.yml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/deploy.yml'], 'message': 'Optimize the deployment of ceph

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
3. Add mon's detection task, because 'delegate_host' must have a
value at the node where mon is located, which prevents us from using
'--limit' to fix the osd node separately.
4. The current deployment will affect all enabled services, which is
not conducive to maintaining the entire cluster. This commit adds
'ceph_install_daemons' so that we can control the services to be
installed.
5. The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users
can use the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter to control whether
to restart the container when ceph.conf changes.
6. The osd container may have problems frequently. At this time, we
need to fix osd and not affect other osd, so we have to avoid image
changes, which makes us very passive, because sometimes the image will
fix some bugs. This commit adds a judgment on the running container.
Use 'ceph_container_running_restart' to avoid restarting the running
container in deploy.

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize the deployment of ceph

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
3. Add mon's detection task, because 'delegate_host' must have a
value at the node where mon is located, which prevents us from using
'--limit' to fix the osd node separately.
4. The current deployment will affect all enabled services, which is
not conducive to maintaining the entire cluster. This commit adds
'ceph_install_daemons' so that we can control the services to be
installed.
5. The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users
can use the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter to control whether
to restart the container when ceph.conf changes.
6. The osd container may have problems frequently. At this time, we
need to fix osd and not affect other osd, so we have to avoid image
changes, which makes us very passive, because sometimes the image will
fix some bugs. This commit adds a judgment on the running container.
Use 'ceph_container_running_restart' to avoid restarting the running
container in deploy.

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f

commit_message:
Add vendor_passthru method for subscriptions

This patch adds two new vendor_passthru methods for Redfish:
- create_subscription (create a sbuscription)
- delete_subscription (delete a subscription)
- get_all_subscriptions (get all subscriptions on the node)
- get_subscription (get a single subscription)

Unit Tests in test_utils split into multiple classes to avoid random
failures due to cache.

Tested in bifrost env using two different HW:
- HPE EL8000 e910
- Dell R640

Story: #2009061
Task: #42854
Change-Id: I5b7fa99b0ee64ccdc0f62d9686df655082db3665

subject: Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-02 15:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/horizon/tasks/policy_item.yml'], 'message': 'Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files

When supported_policy_files gets set under python 3.7 [1], the regex '(.*)'
matches twice, once for the policy file name and once more for the empty string
that follows the policy file name. This is new behavior under python
3.7. [2]

This leads to the replacement string being written out twice resulting
in something like this: "nova_policy.yamlnova_".

This patch changes the regex to '(.+)' ensuring there is no match success
against the empty string.

[1]:
- set_fact:
    supported_policy_files: "{{ supported_policy_format_list | map('regex_replace', '(.*)', '{{ project_name }}_\\1') | list }}"

[2]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.sub

Change-Id: Ie5278832e293364c66d53ddb07dff9c5409f0cc6
Closes-Bug: 1851249
(cherry picked from commit 9d0ccad15aa358cdc6dc2f690bf181cb8354d150)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files

When supported_policy_files gets set under python 3.7 [1], the regex '(.*)'
matches twice, once for the policy file name and once more for the empty string
that follows the policy file name. This is new behavior under python
3.7. [2]

This leads to the replacement string being written out twice resulting
in something like this: "nova_policy.yamlnova_".

This patch changes the regex to '(.+)' ensuring there is no match success
against the empty string.

[1]:
- set_fact:
    supported_policy_files: "{{ supported_policy_format_list | map('regex_replace', '(.*)', '{{ project_name }}_\\1') | list }}"

[2]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.sub

Change-Id: Ie5278832e293364c66d53ddb07dff9c5409f0cc6
Closes-Bug: 1851249
(cherry picked from commit 9d0ccad15aa358cdc6dc2f690bf181cb8354d150)

commit_message:
Adding molecule test for fetch-images role

This patch adds a molecule scenario using the docker driver for the
fetch-images roles. It avoids fetching from network since tests
cannot rely on that to pass or not, and uses file:/// to get the
image and calculate the md5sum.

Change-Id: I53bbbfa17203191b98595b2125dee3bf312fd912
Taiga: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1460
