commit_message:
Add py39 testing and support

We are switching to use the python3-wallaby template [1] but with
py39 voting so we explicitly override and add it to the gate. We also
want to keep py37 tests so this is also added to the gate as the wallaby
template doesn't cover it.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/commit/c5112bc8a155f0c37174ce419bed57a1fc80dd04/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L612

Change-Id: Id9dc68ce9763c3524b060d7824740b1d7c4ba41b

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2021-04-07 09:27:35.000000000', 'files': ['install-deps.sh'], 'message': 'Fixes ignored failure to run repo config-manager

Because we used `|| true`, we failed to spot the missing sudo for a
very long time.

New code avoids global ignore of errors and enables epel only if
is found among the available repos.

Change-Id: I4bb8878d3dd5b0bd449f6c8659c92bc31388e010
Example: https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/build/cf703d876f5740088f0571fd8e5cf82f
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes ignored failure to run repo config-manager

Because we used `|| true`, we failed to spot the missing sudo for a
very long time.

New code avoids global ignore of errors and enables epel only if
is found among the available repos.

Change-Id: I4bb8878d3dd5b0bd449f6c8659c92bc31388e010
Example: https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/build/cf703d876f5740088f0571fd8e5cf82f

commit_message:
Run collect logs with v1 verbosity

Avoids creating huge logs on collect which make hard to even load
inside the browser.

Change-Id: I81aea9d78e38f61cc18d26333666336da62bc089
Related: TRIPLEOCI-305
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/773379

commit_message:
Make use of black formatting

- removes lots of flake8 ignored errors which are automatically
  fixed by black reformatting
- activate black
- move flake8 config to recommended official location in order to
  assure it used by all tools (any config put inside pre-commit would
  not be available outside it)

Note that all the files touched that are not in the root of this
repository were reformatted by black, which assures that the byte-code
is the same before and after the reformatting.

Change-Id: Ie463d17a71b2c85a0951aabfd5637f28c809d257

subject: WIP: Test use of tox-ansible as test runner
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-04-14 11:53:34.000000000', 'files': ['galaxy.yml', 'zuul.d/molecule.yaml', '.gitignore', 'zuul.d/base.yaml', 'zuul.d/playbooks/run.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'WIP: Test use of tox-ansible as test runner

This change aims to reuse tox-ansible plugin in order to eliminate
most of our custom code used for running molecule scenarios.

When ready it should work like:
- each molecule scenario would be visible as a tox environment,
  running `tox -va` will display all available scenarios and which
  effective molecule commands they really run
- zuul will call tox for scenarios
- developers should be able to run a specific scenario locally by
  just calling `tox -e scenario-name`

Change-Id: I193b2c583921a8cd4c83267dc23e051be553f6bc
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Test use of tox-ansible as test runner

This change aims to reuse tox-ansible plugin in order to eliminate
most of our custom code used for running molecule scenarios.

When ready it should work like:
- each molecule scenario would be visible as a tox environment,
  running `tox -va` will display all available scenarios and which
  effective molecule commands they really run
- zuul will call tox for scenarios
- developers should be able to run a specific scenario locally by
  just calling `tox -e scenario-name`

Change-Id: I193b2c583921a8cd4c83267dc23e051be553f6bc

commit_message:
Run flake8 using pre-commit

- Runs flake8 using pre-commit so we can easily add other
  linters/hooks and keep them isolated.
- Moves flake8 config to recommended location
- Upgrades hacking to latest version (4.4.0)
- Fixes problems reported by the upgraded linter

Change-Id: I80c190c24c907e5074e5e79edcdfc08bec689fb3
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/hacking/+/783820

commit_message:
Switch tripleo-ci-base-multinode job to use single playbook

As described in the related bug we are seeing timeouts here and
using a single playbook has been shown to fix it.

commit_message:
BaR - Ceph Backup

Backup and Restore:
  This task aims to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph directory and
copied to the shared directory.
  To be able to do it, we copy the way that the ceph-ansible project [1]
deactivates the mds [2], so we can stop all the ceph services on the
controllers.

[1]-https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/
[2]-https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/v4.0.14/infrastructure-playbooks/rolling_update.yml#L550-L623

I left the comment below to describe and give some backgroud.
** Just splitting the patch into patches.
All the Randy's comments are implemented.
The other patch is https://review.opendev.org/#/c/732399/

Change-Id: I55681d69cacf2e7bee52d9a61f12d8577fe15a2d
(cherry picked from commit a930407217c7478a4b0141d28b9377973d840f97)

subject: fix:fix an error while changing redis volume size
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2021-06-11 09:26:16.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/volume.py'], 'message': 'fix:fix an error while changing redis volume size

Trove version:rocky
In the logic of disk unloading of single redis instace,the exception loopingcall.LoopingCallTimeOut can not be catched;
The method trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_mount return "True"
As a result, taskmanger raise a timeout error,volume-resize faild.

Steps to reproduce:
Create a single redis instance,then use cmd "trove resize-volume INSTANCE_ID 32" to expand volume from 16G to 32G,then an error occured.

Error log from taskmanager:
2021-06-01 19:25:16.652 25165 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server GuestError: An error occurred communicating with the guest: Looping call timed out after
1.18 seconds.
Error log from guestagent:
ERROR oslo.service.loopingcall %self._error_time)
ERROR oslo.service.rpc.server %self._error_time)

Description about the error:
  Use cmd "trove show  INSTANCE_ID" ,the field volume is 32G. Then you log in to this nova_instance,use cmd "df -h",the size of Corresponding filesystem is still 16G.

Fix:To raise the extra Loopingcall.LoopcallTimeOut exception in trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_monut

task: 42538
story: error while changing redis volume size
Change-Id: I2204a8821cee72b3c8969ade0f173c3e5f28f5c5
'}]
commit_message:
fix:fix an error while changing redis volume size

Trove version:rocky
In the logic of disk unloading of single redis instace,the exception loopingcall.LoopingCallTimeOut can not be catched;
The method trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_mount return "True"
As a result, taskmanger raise a timeout error,volume-resize faild.

Steps to reproduce:
Create a single redis instance,then use cmd "trove resize-volume INSTANCE_ID 32" to expand volume from 16G to 32G,then an error occured.

Error log from taskmanager:
2021-06-01 19:25:16.652 25165 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server GuestError: An error occurred communicating with the guest: Looping call timed out after
1.18 seconds.
Error log from guestagent:
ERROR oslo.service.loopingcall %self._error_time)
ERROR oslo.service.rpc.server %self._error_time)

Description about the error:
  Use cmd "trove show  INSTANCE_ID" ,the field volume is 32G. Then you log in to this nova_instance,use cmd "df -h",the size of Corresponding filesystem is still 16G.

Fix:To raise the extra Loopingcall.LoopcallTimeOut exception in trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_monut

task: 42538
story: error while changing redis volume size
Change-Id: I2204a8821cee72b3c8969ade0f173c3e5f28f5c5

subject: db: Replace sqlalchemy-migrate call with alembic equivalent
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2021-07-13 16:19:46.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/alembic_migrations/versions/ocata_expand01_add_visibility.py'], 'message': "db: Replace sqlalchemy-migrate call with alembic equivalent

The 'ocata_expand01_add_visibility' alembic migration was calling
'alter' on a table column, something that is only possible once you've
monkey patched sqlalchemy by importing the 'migrate' module. Resolve
this.

Change-Id: Ic71710aebafa38dceeead104b3e97fafa4bb4362
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
db: Replace sqlalchemy-migrate call with alembic equivalent

The 'ocata_expand01_add_visibility' alembic migration was calling
'alter' on a table column, something that is only possible once you've
monkey patched sqlalchemy by importing the 'migrate' module. Resolve
this.

Change-Id: Ic71710aebafa38dceeead104b3e97fafa4bb4362
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:

When there is a text search and a filter facet applied together,
deleting the filter facet makes the remaining text search ignored.

'}]
commit_message:
Magic Search filter facet removal fix

When there is a text search and a filter facet applied together,
deleting the filter facet makes the remaining text search ignored.
This patch fixes it, calling text search if text facet remains.

Closes-Bug: #1930929

Change-Id: I343dc4220d572669a1b36ed9cf2d10d4dacf7166

commit_message:
Move placement specs to placement repo

Mistakenly the computing team merged two specs in nova that actually
targeting the placement service. Placement has its own specs directory
to store these. So this patch removes these specs and adds redirect for
them to point to the placement repository.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/800769

Change-Id: I00662becb350557ba96bb119c91443ce27064782

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-03-09 11:38:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/zanata/zanata_stats.py'], 'message': 'Zanata stats tool: improve speed with user API

This patch enhances the speed of Zanata stats by using
user-based Zanata APIs rather than project-based APIs,
which took >1 days as more Zanata users and translation data
were accumulated.

Note that the API scheme follows with Stackalytics
: https://opendev.org/x/stackalytics/src/branch/master/stackalytics/processor/zanata.py#L38

Change-Id: Ia2462447f7a0cc2534e877976838de09e8683e89
'}]
commit_message:
Zanata stats tool: improve speed with user API

This patch enhances the speed of Zanata stats by using
user-based Zanata APIs rather than project-based APIs,
which took >1 days as more Zanata users and translation data
were accumulated.

Note that the API scheme follows with Stackalytics
: https://opendev.org/x/stackalytics/src/branch/master/stackalytics/processor/zanata.py#L38

Change-Id: Ia2462447f7a0cc2534e877976838de09e8683e89

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-10 13:44:29.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], dash-separated options causes a warning
message like [2] and we should replace dashes with underscores.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

[2]
UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I05d9c484bb669ae33211e88924b20b7cfe7d0d67
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], dash-separated options causes a warning
message like [2] and we should replace dashes with underscores.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

[2]
UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I05d9c484bb669ae33211e88924b20b7cfe7d0d67

commit_message:
Add missing font for PDF generation

openstack-tox-docs job started to fail with the following error:

! LaTeX Error: File `tgtermes.sty' not found.

This patch adds the required font package to bindep doc profile.

Co-authored-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Closes-Bug: #1935742
Change-Id: Idc7ba5b1211327a258b2972f9271b09916598cb3

subject: Scoped RBAC Devstack Plugin support
revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2021-07-15 21:58:37.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml', 'devstack/lib/ironic', 'zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': "Scoped RBAC Devstack Plugin support

Adds support to the ironic devstack plugin to configure
ironic to be used in a scope-enforcing mode in line with
the Secure RBAC effort. This change also defines two new
integration jobs *and* changes one of the existing
integration.

In these cases, we're testing functional crub interactions,
integration with nova, and integration with ironic-inspector.

As other services come online with their plugins and
devstack code being able to set the appropriate scope
enforcement configuration, we will be able to change the
overall operating default for all of ironic's jobs and
exclude the differences.

This effort identified issues in ironic-tempest-plugin,
tempest, devstack, and required plugin support in
ironic-inspector as well, and is ultimately required
to ensure we do not break the Secure RBAC.

Luckilly, it all works.

Change-Id: Ic40e47cb11a6b6e9915efcb12e7912861f25cae7
"}]
commit_message:
Scoped RBAC Devstack Plugin support

Adds support to the ironic devstack plugin to configure
ironic to be used in a scope-enforcing mode in line with
the Secure RBAC effort. This change also defines two new
integration jobs *and* changes one of the existing
integration.

In these cases, we're testing functional crub interactions,
integration with nova, and integration with ironic-inspector.

As other services come online with their plugins and
devstack code being able to set the appropriate scope
enforcement configuration, we will be able to change the
overall operating default for all of ironic's jobs and
exclude the differences.

This effort identified issues in ironic-tempest-plugin,
tempest, devstack, and required plugin support in
ironic-inspector as well, and is ultimately required
to ensure we do not break the Secure RBAC.

Luckilly, it all works.

Change-Id: Ic40e47cb11a6b6e9915efcb12e7912861f25cae7

subject: Ignore stale image property removal
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2021-04-08 14:42:22.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_db.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Ignore stale image property removal

Occasionally we fail to delete a property from an image and get a
StaleDataError from SQLAlchemy. It looks like maybe we are just racing
with another operation to delete a single property (i.e. a race
between image delete and the end of an import cleanup).

This ignores that "can't delete because it is already deleted" error
and logs to debug about the situation for later auditing and
confirmation.

Change-Id: Ida5bc659b7481fa0a7f3926a54520628a7a4c406
Closes-Bug: #1895173
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore stale image property removal

Occasionally we fail to delete a property from an image and get a
StaleDataError from SQLAlchemy. It looks like maybe we are just racing
with another operation to delete a single property (i.e. a race
between image delete and the end of an import cleanup).

This ignores that "can't delete because it is already deleted" error
and logs to debug about the situation for later auditing and
confirmation.

Change-Id: Ida5bc659b7481fa0a7f3926a54520628a7a4c406
Closes-Bug: #1895173

commit_message:
db: Move 'schema' module up a level

We want to remove the old sqlalchemy-migrate based migrations. Move the
only remaining module we need from this up a level so we can 'rm -rf'
the entire directory in a future change.

Change-Id: I3b1a1668c48e3136fd91b1418e00c38deec76bb5
Implements: blueprint remove-sqlalchemy-migrate
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:

This follows the same pattern of configuration used in the
object-expirer.  When the container-recociler has a configuration value
for processes it expects that many instances of the reconciler to be
configured with a process value from [0, processes).

Change-Id: Ie46bda37ca3f6e692ec31a4ddcd46f343fb1aeca
'}]
commit_message:
container-reconciler: support multiple processes

This follows the same pattern of configuration used in the
object-expirer.  When the container-recociler has a configuration value
for processes it expects that many instances of the reconciler to be
configured with a process value from [0, processes).

Change-Id: Ie46bda37ca3f6e692ec31a4ddcd46f343fb1aeca

commit_message:
vdpa: Introducing the vdpa PF flag

Now that nova supports vDPA interfaces, we need to configure them using
os_net_config for tripleo consumption.

Related: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-docs/+/798237/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1917762
Change-Id: I202fe57360cca79883457444bdae2cf41ba25798
(cherry picked from commit baab05e9bb2850d76275a9397036c1a8d4a9131a)
